comments:
If a static home page is used and no standby page is specified, an
IllegalArgumentException occurs when you shut down the workbench or when you put
the intro into standby. If you put the intro into standby, the whole workbench
gets hosed and you have to shut down.  Since the standby page id is an optional
attribute, this is pretty bad.

Here is the stack trace:

Correction: the situation is if a static home page is used and a DYNAMIC standby
page is specified.  I don't think we state anywhere that you can't mix static
and dynamic in this situation.

working as designed (without the crash of-course) 
Kim.
see my comments to bug 68420.
When we talked about static pages, we said that if the root page is static, 
then all pages are static and are not defined in content markup. Only root and 
standby can be defined and are static pages. 

For you to get the static and dynamic page mix, you have to start of with a 
dynamic page. 

We can resvisit this behavior next release, but we can also keep this bug open 
because we should not crash like this.
This is working for me using I20070621-1340. I can have a static root and either a dynamic standby page or no standby page and everything seems to work OK.
